info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:08PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Susquehanna and northwestern Wayne Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 407 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Montrose, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Susquehanna, Susquehanna Depot, Montrose, Harford, Hallstead, Hancock, New Milford, Great Bend and Ararat. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 217 and 230. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
